baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of mixed-ability seating (treat1=MS) vs. same-ability seating (control) on lower-track students' endline academic performance (standardized average score ave3), in elementary schools in Longhui county, China.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Endline academic performance (standardized composite of Chinese and math scores, ave3)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Mixed-ability seating (treat1=MS) vs. traditional same-ability seating (control)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT effect via ANCOVA-OLS with grade FE, clustered SE at classroom level
baseline_groups.target_population: Lower-track elementary school students (hsco==0), grades 3-5, Longhui county
baseline_groups.expected_sign: ambiguous (paper finds near-zero effect, p~0.88 for treat1 on ave3)

baseline_specs.notes: Primary baseline: full controls + grade1 FE + cluster(class1), lower track
Table 3 Panel A Col1: no controls beyond baseline score, lower track
Table 3 Panel A Col4: Chinese score sub-outcome, lower track
Table 3 Panel A Col6: math score sub-outcome, lower track

Table 3 Panel B Col2: upper-track sample (hsco==1), different population from G1 baseline. Included in surface core_universe as a planned paper-table replication. Note: design block in coefficient_vector_json still shows sample_restriction=hsco==0 (stale metadata), but sample_desc and N correctly reflect upper track.

baseline_groups.notes: All 40 G1 specs executed as planned in surface core_universe. No missing or extra specs. spec_0037 (rc/treatment/treat2_focal) correctly reports treat2 coefficient (0.1388) but treatment_var column metadata says 'treat1' — minor labeling issue, coefficient value itself is correct.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of mixed-ability seating (treat1=MS) vs. same-ability seating (control) on lower-track students' Big Five personality traits (extraversion, agreeableness, openness, neuroticism, conscientiousness) at endline.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Endline Big Five personality traits (extra2, agree2, open2, neur2, cons2)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Mixed-ability seating (treat1=MS) vs. traditional same-ability seating (control)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT effect via ANCOVA-OLS with grade FE, clustered SE at classroom level
baseline_groups.target_population: Lower-track elementary school students (hsco==0), grades 3-5, Longhui county
baseline_groups.expected_sign: ambiguous (paper finds near-zero effects on personality at p~0.2-0.98)

baseline_specs.notes: Primary baseline: extraversion (extra2), full controls + grade1 FE + cluster(class1)
Table 4 Panel A: agreeableness, lower track
Table 4 Panel A: openness, lower track
Table 4 Panel A: neuroticism, lower track
Table 4 Panel A: conscientiousness, lower track

Table 4 Panel B: openness, upper-track sample (hsco==1)

Table 4 Panel B: conscientiousness, upper-track sample (hsco==1)

baseline_groups.notes: All 31 G2 specs executed as planned in surface core_universe. No missing or extra specs. G2 does not include rc/sample/pre_attrition or rc/fe/add/school (budget-constrained; consistent with surface plan). spec_0069 (rc/treatment/treat2_focal) correctly reports treat2 coefficient (2.3248) but treatment_var metadata says 'treat1' — minor labeling issue, coefficient value is correct.

global_notes: No edits to baseline-group assignments relative to the surface. All 71 rows match the surface plan exactly (40 G1 + 31 G2). All rows ran successfully. Two minor metadata issues noted: (1) spec_0037 and spec_0069 (rc/treatment/treat2_focal) have treatment_var='treat1' in the CSV but the focal coefficient is treat2's — the coefficient value is correctly extracted; (2) spec_0005 and spec_0046 (upper-track baselines) have a stale sample_restriction='hsco==0' in the design block of coefficient_vector_json, though sample_desc correctly shows hsco==1 and N=901. Neither issue affects validity of the extracted estimates.
